title: Hyderabadi Chicken Biryani
ingredients: 500g chicken (marinated in yogurt, chili, and biryani masala)
Whole spices (bay leaf, cloves, cinnamon, cardamom)
Saffron milk + mint + coriander for layering
instructions: Soak rice for 30 minutes, then cook until 70% done.
Fry onions until golden brown and set aside.
Cook marinated chicken until almost done.
In a pot, layer rice and chicken alternately.
Top with saffron milk, fried onions, mint, and coriander.
Seal with lid and cook on low flame for 20 minutes (dum).

title: Pesarattu (Green Gram Dosa)
instructions: Soak green gram overnight or for 6 hours.
Grind with ginger, green chilies, and salt to a smooth batter.
Heat a tawa, spread batter into thin dosa shape.
Roast both sides with a little oil until golden brown.
Serve hot with ginger chutney.

title: Gongura Pachadi (Sorrel Leaves Chutney)
instructions: Wash and clean gongura leaves thoroughly.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds.
Add dried red chilies and garlic, sautÃ© until fragrant.
Add gongura leaves and cook until they wilt completely.
Add tamarind pulp, salt, and turmeric powder.
Cook for 5-7 minutes until oil separates. Cool and grind to paste.

title: Andhra Chicken Curry
instructions: Marinate chicken with turmeric, salt, and half the ginger-garlic paste for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan, add onions and sautÃ© until golden brown.
Add remaining ginger-garlic paste and cook until raw smell disappears.
Add tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
Add all spice powders and cook until oil separates.
Add marinated chicken and cook covered until tender.
Garnish with curry leaves and coriander leaves.

title: Rava Dosa (Semolina Crepes)
instructions: Mix semolina, rice flour, and all-purpose flour in a bowl.
Add yogurt and mix well, then add water to make thin batter.
Add cumin seeds, black pepper, green chilies, and ginger.
Add curry leaves, coriander leaves, and salt. Mix well.
Let batter rest for 15-20 minutes.
Heat tawa, pour batter in circular motion to make thin dosas.
Cook until crispy and golden brown on both sides.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: South Indian Breakfast Specialists

title: Pulihora (Tamarind Rice)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds.
Add dried red chilies, peanuts, and cashews. Roast until golden.
Add curry leaves and tamarind pulp.
Add turmeric powder and salt. Cook until oil separates.
Add cooked rice and mix gently until well combined.
Cook for 2-3 minutes on low heat. Serve warm.

title: Coconut Chutney
ingredients: For tempering: 1 tsp oil, mustard seeds, curry leaves, dried red chili
instructions: Grind coconut, roasted chana dal, green chilies, ginger, and cumin seeds.
Add salt and water to make smooth paste.
Heat oil for tempering, add mustard seeds.
Add curry leaves and dried red chili.
Pour tempering over chutney and mix well.
Serve with dosas, idlis, or rice.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: South Indian Chutney Masters

title: Bisi Bele Bath (Spicy Rice & Lentils)
instructions: Cook rice and toor dal together until soft.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Add cashews and peanuts, roast until golden.
Add vegetables and cook until tender.
Add bisi bele bath powder and tamarind pulp.
Add cooked rice-dal mixture and mix well.
Cook for 10-15 minutes on low heat. Serve hot.

title: Masala Dosa
ingredients: For dosa batter: 2 cups rice, 1 cup urad dal, salt
For potato masala: 3 potatoes, 1 onion, 2 green chilies, curry leaves, mustard seeds, turmeric, salt
instructions: Soak rice and urad dal separately for 6 hours.
Grind separately, mix together, add salt, and ferment overnight.
Boil potatoes, peel and mash them.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies.
Add onions, sautÃ© until golden, add turmeric and salt.
Add mashed potatoes and mix well.
Make thin dosas, add potato masala, fold, and serve hot.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: South Indian Dosa Masters

title: Gutti Vankaya (Stuffed Brinjal Curry)
instructions: Make cross cuts in brinjals without separating them.
Grind peanuts, sesame seeds, and coconut to coarse powder.
Mix ground powder with all spice powders and salt.
Stuff this mixture into the brinjals.
Heat oil in a pan, add curry leaves.
Add stuffed brinjals and cook covered until tender.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.
